name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  The nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue is, for jejunum and ileum, part of the mesentery and, for duodenum in areas where serosa is lacking, part of the interface with the pancreas.

**Note 2:**  Code depth of invasion in preference to intraluminal spread or lateral extension to adjacent segment(s) of small intestine or cecum.

**Note 3:** High-grade dysplasia is not always collected by cancer registries but, if collected, it should be coded as in situ (code 000).

    Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS

    Localized, NOS
